name: Polish Music
description: Music rooted in the traditions of the Poles.

children.name: Chicago Polka
children.description: Polish-American style known for slower tempo, improvisation and the ensemble typically including the clarinet, trumpet, and concertina.

children.name: Disco polo
children.description: Polish Dance-Pop, originally established from contemporary wedding / feast songs and Italo-Disco.

children.name: Eastern-Style Polka
children.description: Fast, urban Polish-American style performed by a Big Band-like ensemble.

children.name: Mazur
children.description: Lively triple-time national dance with folk origins, popular with the nobility and in the 19th century ballrooms.

children.name: Mazurka
children.description: Folk or folk-inspired form based on the triple-time rhythm of Mazur, Kujawiak and Oberek.

children.name: Miejski folk
children.description: Alternative and Punk music influenced by Folklor miejski and Contemporary Folk.

children.name: Poezja Å›piewana
children.description: Polish sung poetry; the poem is the centerpiece of a song, often with sparse instrumental accompaniment.

children.name: Polish Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of the Poles.

children.name: Polonaise
children.description: Stately national dance with music in triple meter and moderate tempo.
